title: Establishes the empire revolving bridge loan fund within the urban development corporation
summary: Establishes the empire revolving bridge loan fund within the urban development corporation act to promote economic development; provides that the fund shall consist of the net proceeds of one or more series of bonds or notes issued; defines terms; requires the urban development corporation to give preference to certain eligible projects; makes related provisions.
lawSection: New York State Urban Development Corporation Act

       AN ACT to amend the New York state urban development corporation act, in
         relation  to  establishing  the empire revolving bridge loan fund, and
         authorizing the New York state urban development corporation to  issue
         bonds  or  notes to provide monies for such fund; and to amend chapter
         393 of the laws of 1994, amending the New York state urban development
         corporation act relating to the powers of the  New  York  state  urban
         development  corporation  to make loans, in relation to the effective-
         ness thereof

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1. Section 1 of chapter 174 of the laws of 1968, constituting
    2  the New York state urban development  corporation  act,  is  amended  by
    3  adding a new section 16-u to read as follows:
    4    S  16-U.   EMPIRE REVOLVING BRIDGE LOAN FUND. 1. IT IS HEREBY DECLARED
    5  THAT IT IS A VITAL POLICY AND  PUBLIC  PURPOSE  OF  NEW  YORK  STATE  TO
    6  PROMOTE SIGNIFICANT ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT IN NEW YORK. THE HISTORY OF NEW
    7  YORK  IS  MARKED  BY  LARGE-SCALE ECONOMIC ENDEAVORS WHICH HARNESSED THE
    8  CREATIVITY, SKILL AND VISION OF THE RESIDENTS OF NEW  YORK.  THE  TRANS-
    9  FORMING  POWER  OF  THESE  ACCOMPLISHMENTS  IS BEST EMBODIED IN THE ERIE
   10  CANAL, WHICH CREATED IN ITS WAKE A  SURGE  OF  ECONOMIC  AND  POPULATION
   11  GROWTH  IN  NEW YORK. IN CONTRAST, THE LEGISLATURE HEREBY FINDS THAT THE
   12  CURRENT ECONOMIC CLIMATE OF NEW YORK AS A WHOLE IS MARKED BY  PERSISTENT
   13  DISINVESTMENT,  BLIGHT AND AGING INFRASTRUCTURE, LOSS OF OPEN SPACE, AND
   14  EMIGRATION OF EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITIES AND INVESTMENT DOLLARS, AND  THAT
   15  RECREATING THE ENVIRONMENT OF ENERGY AND RISK-TAKING THAT DROVE THE ERIE
   16  CANAL  IS  ESSENTIAL  TO  NEW  YORK'S FUTURE WELL-BEING. THE LEGISLATURE
   17  FINDS THAT IN ORDER TO REVERSE THE TRENDS OF DECLINE,  IT  IS  NECESSARY

    1  AND APPROPRIATE TO ESTABLISH A PUBLIC/PRIVATE FINANCING MODEL TO PROMOTE
    2  ECONOMIC  DEVELOPMENT  IN  NEW  YORK WHILE MAXIMIZING LEVERAGE NEEDED TO
    3  ASSIST IN FINANCING SUCH PROJECTS AND DO SO IN AN EXPEDITED MANNER.  THE
    4  LEGISLATURE  HEREBY FINDS THAT CURRENT CONDITIONS IN CREDIT MARKETS HAVE
    5  HAD A NEGATIVE EFFECT ON SIGNIFICANT ECONOMIC  DEVELOPMENT  PROJECTS  IN
    6  NEW  YORK.  IT IS THE OVERRIDING PUBLIC POLICY OF THIS STATE TO CREATE A
    7  VEHICLE TO PROVIDE SHORT-TERM FINANCING FOR IMPORTANT  PROJECTS  IN  NEW
    8  YORK TO ENSURE THE HEALTH, WELFARE AND PROSPERITY OF ALL CITIZENS OF THE
    9  STATE.
   10    2.  THERE  IS  HEREBY  ESTABLISHED IN THE CUSTODY OF THE CORPORATION A
   11  SPECIAL FUND TO BE KNOWN AS THE "EMPIRE REVOLVING BRIDGE LOAN FUND".
   12    3. THE FUND SHALL CONSIST OF THE NET PROCEEDS OF ONE OR MORE SERIES OF
   13  BONDS OR NOTES ISSUED, AT ANY TIME AND FROM TIME TO TIME, BY THE  CORPO-
   14  RATION  PURSUANT TO ARTICLE 5-C OF THE STATE FINANCE LAW AND SUBDIVISION
   15  NINE OF THIS SECTION FOR THE PURPOSES OF THIS SECTION, ALL MONIES TRANS-
   16  FERRED TO SUCH FUND PURSUANT TO LAW, ALL MONEYS DONATED TO IT,  PAYMENTS
   17  OF  PRINCIPAL  ON  LOANS  MADE  FROM THE FUND, AND ANY INTEREST EARNINGS
   18  WHICH MAY ACCRUE FROM THE INVESTMENT OR REINVESTMENT OF MONEYS FROM  THE
   19  FUND. THE MONIES HELD IN OR CREDITED TO THE FUND SHALL BE EXPENDED SOLE-
   20  LY FOR THE PURPOSES SET FORTH IN THIS SECTION. THE CORPORATION SHALL NOT
   21  COMMINGLE  THE  MONIES  OF SUCH FUND WITH ANY OTHER MONIES OF THE CORPO-
   22  RATION OR ANY MONIES HELD IN TRUST BY THE CORPORATION.
   23    4. MONIES OF THE FUND, WHEN  ALLOCATED,  SHALL  BE  AVAILABLE  TO  THE
   24  CORPORATION  TO  MAKE  LOANS  TO  ELIGIBLE  PROJECTS AS PROVIDED IN THIS
   25  SECTION. NOTWITHSTANDING ANY OTHER PROVISION OF  LAW,  FOR  PURPOSES  OF
   26  THIS SECTION, THE FOLLOWING TERMS SHALL HAVE THE ACCOMPANYING MEANINGS:
   27    (A) "APPLICANT" SHALL MEAN THAT INDIVIDUAL OR ENTITY, OR SUCH INDIVID-
   28  UAL  OR  ENTITY'S  AGENT,  SUCCESSOR  IN INTEREST, ASSIGNEE OR DESIGNEE,
   29  WHICH FILES AN APPLICATION WITH THE CORPORATION FOR CONSIDERATION OF  AN
   30  ELIGIBLE PROJECT.
   31    (B)  "BROWNFIELD  SITE"  SHALL  HAVE  THE MEANING SET FORTH IN SECTION
   32  27-1405 OF THE ENVIRONMENTAL CONSERVATION LAW.
   33    (C) "ELIGIBLE PROJECT" SHALL MEAN ANY NEW  EQUIPMENT,  IMPROVEMENT  OR
   34  STRUCTURE,  INCLUDING  NEW  CONSTRUCTION,  ALTERATION  OR IMPROVEMENT TO
   35  EXISTING STRUCTURES, AND ALL REAL AND PERSONAL PROPERTY DEEMED NECESSARY
   36  THEREWITH, WHICH IS PROJECTED TO (I) COST A MINIMUM  OF  TWENTY  MILLION
   37  DOLLARS, (II) RESULT IN THE CREATION, IN ONE OR MORE PHASES, OF AT LEAST
   38  THREE  HUNDRED  NEW  FULL  TIME EQUIVALENT JOBS AT THE PROJECT SITE, AND
   39  (III) ONE OR MORE OF THE FOLLOWING: (A) WILL BE DESIGNED AND CONSTRUCTED
   40  TO ACHIEVE "GOLD" STATUS OR HIGHER PURSUANT TO THE LEADERSHIP IN  ENERGY
   41  AND  ENVIRONMENTAL DESIGN ("LEED") GREEN BUILDING RATING SYSTEM CRITERIA
   42  DEVELOPED BY THE UNITED STATES GREEN BUILDING COUNCIL  OR  (B)  WILL  BE
   43  DESIGNED AND CONSTRUCTED TO ACHIEVE "3 GLOBES" OR HIGHER PURSUANT TO THE
   44  GREEN  GLOBES  RATING SYSTEM DEVELOPED BY THE GREEN BUILDING INITIATIVE;
   45  OR (C) WILL UTILIZE TECHNOLOGY-ENABLED DESIGN, CONSTRUCTION AND  COOPER-
   46  ATION INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, GENERALLY ACCEPTED UNIVERSAL DESIGN
   47  PRINCIPLES  THAT  ENHANCE THE FULL CYCLE USE OF BUILDINGS WITHOUT REGARD
   48  TO THE PHYSICAL ABILITIES OR DISABILITIES  OF  OCCUPANTS  OR  GUESTS  IN
   49  ORDER  TO  ACCOMMODATE  A WIDE RANGE OF INDIVIDUAL PREFERENCES AND FUNC-
   50  TIONAL  ABILITIES.  IF  A  PHASE  OF  THE  ELIGIBLE  PROJECT  IS   UNDER
   51  CONSTRUCTION AS OF THE DATE OF THE APPLICATION, THEN ANY JOBS CREATED AS
   52  OF SUCH DATE SHALL BE CONSIDERED JOBS CREATED FOR PURPOSES OF THIS DEFI-
   53  NITION.
   54    THE CORPORATION SHALL GIVE PREFERENCE TO THOSE ELIGIBLE PROJECTS WHICH
   55  MEET  EITHER  OR BOTH OF THE FOLLOWING CRITERIA: (I) THE SITE IS LOCATED
   56  IN AN AREA OF A MUNICIPALITY OR REGION CHARACTERIZED BY  HIGH  UNEMPLOY-

    1  MENT, A HIGH POVERTY RATE AND/OR A HIGH COMMERCIAL VACANCY RATE; OR (II)
    2  THE  APPLICANT'S  PROPOSED ELIGIBLE PROJECT WILL BE LOCATED, IN WHOLE OR
    3  IN PART, ON A BROWNFIELD SITE AS DEFINED IN THIS SECTION.
    4    (D) "ELIGIBLE PURPOSES" SHALL MEAN, NOTWITHSTANDING ARTICLE 5-B OF THE
    5  STATE  FINANCE  LAW,  ALL  COSTS PAID OR INCURRED IN CONNECTION WITH THE
    6  DESIGN AND CONSTRUCTION OF AN ELIGIBLE PROJECT, INCLUDING, WITHOUT LIMI-
    7  TATION, THE COSTS OF LAND  AND  OTHER  INTERESTS,  BUILDINGS,  FIXTURES,
    8  FURNITURE, EQUIPMENT OR MACHINERY, RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT, PERMITTING,
    9  PLANNING,  ENGINEERING, FINANCING, REFINANCING, THE PROVISION OF WORKING
   10  CAPITAL, INVENTORY, MARKETING, EXPENDITURES ASSOCIATED WITH THE  OPENING
   11  OF  AN  ELIGIBLE  PROJECT,  AND/OR OTHER AMOUNTS, INCLUDING RESERVES AND
   12  INTEREST, REQUIRED TO BE PAID IN CONNECTION WITH FINANCING OR  REFINANC-
   13  ING OF THE ELIGIBLE PROJECT.
   14    (E)  "FUND" MEANS THE EMPIRE REVOLVING BRIDGE LOAN FUND ESTABLISHED BY
   15  THIS SECTION.
   16    (F) "SPONSOR" SHALL MEAN THE INDIVIDUAL OR ENTITY OR  SUCH  INDIVIDUAL
   17  OR  ENTITY'S  AGENT,  ASSIGNEE,  DESIGNEE OR SUCCESSOR IN INTEREST WHOSE
   18  APPLICATION FOR TREATMENT AS AN ELIGIBLE PROJECT HAS  BEEN  APPROVED  BY
   19  THE CORPORATION.
   20    5. EVERY APPLICATION SHALL BE IN A FORM ACCEPTABLE TO THE CORPORATION.
   21  THE  APPLICANT  SHALL  PAY, UPON SUBMISSION OF THE APPLICATION, A FEE OF
   22  ONE THOUSAND DOLLARS. THE CORPORATION SHALL APPROVE  OR  DISAPPROVE,  IN
   23  WHOLE  OR  IN PART, THE REQUESTED LOAN FOR THE ELIGIBLE PROJECT NO LATER
   24  THAN THIRTY DAYS FROM THE DATE OF THE RECEIPT OF THE APPLICATION  OR  AT
   25  THE  NEXT  BOARD  MEETING OCCURRING WITHIN SIXTY DAYS OF THE DATE OF THE
   26  RECEIPT OF THE APPLICATION IF SUCH MEETING IS SCHEDULED FOR A DATE LATER
   27  THAN THIRTY DAYS FROM THE DATE OF  RECEIPT  OF  SUCH  APPLICATION.    IN
   28  CONSIDERING  THE  APPLICATION,  THE  CORPORATION  SHALL CONSIDER FACTORS
   29  AFFECTING THE CREDITWORTHINESS  OF  THE  APPLICANT  INCLUDING,  BUT  NOT
   30  LIMITED  TO,  THE  APPLICANT'S  BUSINESS  PLAN,  BUSINESS EXPERIENCE AND
   31  MANAGEMENT INFORMATION, CREDIT HISTORY AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS,  SUFFI-
   32  CIENCY OF COLLATERAL TO SECURE REPAYMENT OF THE LOAN, OTHER PERSONAL AND
   33  CORPORATE  GUARANTEES  ON  THE  PROJECT,  CASH FLOW PROJECTIONS, AND THE
   34  STRUCTURE AND TIMING OF ANY PROPOSED LONG-TERM FINANCING BY  THE  APPLI-
   35  CANT,  INCLUDING  ANY FINANCING PURSUANT TO THE SELF-SUFFICIENCY PROGRAM
   36  IN SECTION 16-V OF THIS ACT, AS ADDED BY A CHAPTER OF THE LAWS OF  2011.
   37  TO  THE EXTENT PERMITTED BY LAW, ALL INFORMATION REGARDING THE FINANCIAL
   38  CONDITION, MARKETING PLANS, MANUFACTURING PROCESSES,  PRODUCTION  COSTS,
   39  CUSTOMER LISTS, OR OTHER TRADE SECRETS OR PROPRIETARY INFORMATION DEEMED
   40  AS  SUCH  BY  THE APPLICANT IN CONNECTION WITH THE APPLICATION SUBMITTED
   41  PURSUANT TO THIS SECTION, SHALL BE CONFIDENTIAL AND EXEMPT  FROM  PUBLIC
   42  DISCLOSURE.
   43    6.  (A)  THE FUNDS OF THE CORPORATION DERIVED PURSUANT TO THIS SECTION
   44  MAY BE USED TO PROVIDE LOANS TO ELIGIBLE PROJECTS FOR ELIGIBLE PURPOSES.
   45  THE INTEREST RATE ON ANY SUCH LOAN FOR THE TERM OF SUCH  LOAN  SHALL  BE
   46  NOT  MORE  THAN  THE  ALL-IN  TRUE  INTEREST COST TO THE CORPORATION, AS
   47  DETERMINED BY THE CORPORATION, FOR THE BONDS ISSUED PURSUANT TO SUBDIVI-
   48  SION NINE OF THIS SECTION. THE TERM OF ANY LOAN MADE  PURSUANT  TO  THIS
   49  SECTION  SHALL  NOT  EXCEED THREE YEARS. ALL LOANS SHALL BE SECURED BY A
   50  LIEN POSITION ON COLLATERAL AT THE HIGHEST LEVEL OF  PRIORITY  THAT  CAN
   51  ACCOMMODATE  THE  BORROWER'S ABILITY TO RAISE SUFFICIENT DEBT AND EQUITY
   52  CAPITAL FOR THE PROJECT.
   53    (B) THE SPONSOR, UPON NOTICE TO THE CORPORATION WITHIN THIRTY DAYS  OF
   54  THE  EXPIRATION  OF  THE  TERM OF THE LOAN, MAY EXTEND AT ITS OPTION THE
   55  LOAN FOR A ONE-YEAR PERIOD IF THE SPONSOR  IS  IN  COMPLIANCE  WITH  THE
   56  TERMS OF THE LOAN. THE SPONSOR SHALL BE LIMITED TO THREE ONE-YEAR EXTEN-

       A. 540                              4

    1  SIONS.  ANY  SUCH  EXTENSION  SHALL CONTINUE TO BE SECURED IN ACCORDANCE
    2  WITH THE PROVISIONS OF PARAGRAPH (A) OF THIS SUBDIVISION, AND THE INTER-
    3  EST RATE ON SUCH EXTENSION SHALL BE CALCULATED IN THE SAME  WAY  AS  THE
    4  ORIGINAL LOAN.
    5    (C)  THE CORPORATION SHALL, UPON THE REQUEST OF THE SPONSOR, ESTABLISH
    6  A SPECIAL ACCOUNT FOR SUCH SPONSOR WITHIN THE FUND. SUCH  ACCOUNT  SHALL
    7  CONSIST OF THAT PORTION, AS REQUESTED BY THE SPONSOR, OF ANY PROCEEDS OF
    8  BONDS ISSUED PURSUANT TO SUBDIVISION THREE OF THIS SECTION, ALL PAYMENTS
    9  OF  PRINCIPAL  ON  LOANS  MADE  FROM  THE FUND OR SPECIAL ACCOUNT BY THE
   10  APPLICABLE SPONSOR, AND ANY INTEREST EARNINGS THAT MAY ACCRUE  FROM  THE
   11  INVESTMENT OR REINVESTMENT OF MONEYS FROM THE SPECIAL ACCOUNT.  NOTWITH-
   12  STANDING  PARAGRAPHS  (A)  AND  (B) OF THIS SUBDIVISION, THE CORPORATION
   13  SHALL PROVIDE ONE-YEAR EXTENSIONS ON THE ORIGINAL LOAN TO THE APPLICABLE
   14  SPONSOR, PROVIDED THAT THE SPONSOR IS IN COMPLIANCE WITH  THE  TERMS  OF
   15  THE  LOAN,  FROM  THE  SPECIAL  ACCOUNT UNTIL TEN YEARS FROM THE DATE OF
   16  COMMENCEMENT OF THE INITIAL LOAN, AT THE INTEREST RATE OF  SUCH  INITIAL
   17  LOAN,  PROVIDED  THAT  SUFFICIENT  MONEYS ARE ON DEPOSIT IN SUCH SPECIAL
   18  ACCOUNT. ALL LOANS SHALL BE SECURED BY A LIEN POSITION ON COLLATERAL  AT
   19  THE HIGHEST LEVEL OF PRIORITY THAT CAN ACCOMMODATE THE BORROWER'S ABILI-
   20  TY  TO  RAISE  SUFFICIENT  DEBT  AND EQUITY CAPITAL FOR THE PROJECT. THE
   21  AMOUNTS DEPOSITED IN SUCH SPECIAL ACCOUNT MAY  NOT  BE  INTERCHANGED  OR
   22  COMMINGLED WITH ANY OTHER ACCOUNT IN THE FUND. ANY REMAINING MONIES IN A
   23  SPECIAL  ACCOUNT AT THE END OF THE TERM OF THE FINAL LOAN MADE HEREUNDER
   24  SHALL BE TRANSFERRED TO THE GENERAL ACCOUNTS OF THE CORPORATION CONSIST-
   25  ENT WITH APPLICABLE LAW.
   26    7. IN CONNECTION WITH THE UNDERTAKING OF AN ELIGIBLE  PROJECT  BY  THE
   27  CORPORATION, THE SPONSOR SHALL PAY TO THE CORPORATION, AT THE CLOSING OF
   28  EACH LOAN FINANCING BY THE CORPORATION, A CLOSING FEE EQUAL TO THE SPON-
   29  SOR'S  ALLOCABLE  SHARE  OF  THE  COSTS  OF ISSUANCE OF THE BONDS ISSUED
   30  PURSUANT TO SUBDIVISION NINE OF THIS SECTION, PROVIDED HOWEVER THAT SUCH
   31  FEE SHALL NOT EXCEED ONE PERCENT OF THE LOAN AMOUNT. THE ALLOCABLE SHARE
   32  SHALL BE A RATIO, THE NUMERATOR OF WHICH SHALL BE THE  PRINCIPAL  AMOUNT
   33  OF  THE  SPONSOR'S  LOAN,  AND THE DENOMINATOR OF WHICH SHALL BE THE NET
   34  PROCEEDS OF BONDS ISSUED PURSUANT TO SUBDIVISION NINE OF  THIS  SECTION.
   35  THE  APPLICATION  FEE  PAID PURSUANT TO SUBDIVISION FIVE OF THIS SECTION
   36  SHALL BE CREDITED AGAINST SUCH CLOSING FEE.
   37    8. THE CORPORATION SHALL ANNUALLY REPORT, BEGINNING ON OR BEFORE MARCH
   38  15, 2012 AND ON OR BEFORE EACH SUBSEQUENT MARCH 15, TO THE GOVERNOR, THE
   39  CHAIR OF THE SENATE FINANCE COMMITTEE AND THE CHAIR OF THE ASSEMBLY WAYS
   40  AND MEANS COMMITTEE, DESCRIBING THE ACTIVITIES AND OPERATION OF THE LOAN
   41  PROGRAM AUTHORIZED BY THIS SECTION. SUCH REPORTS  SHALL  SET  FORTH  THE
   42  NUMBER OF LOAN APPLICATIONS RECEIVED AND APPROVED; THE NAMES OF SPONSORS
   43  RECEIVING LOANS TOGETHER WITH THE AMOUNT AND PURPOSE OF THE LOAN AND THE
   44  OUTSTANDING BALANCE; THE NUMBER OF JOBS CREATED AND/OR RETAINED; AND THE
   45  BALANCE  REMAINING  IN THE EMPIRE REVOLVING BRIDGE LOAN FUND, ALONG WITH
   46  FUND REVENUES  AND  EXPENDITURES  FOR  THE  PREVIOUS  FISCAL  YEAR,  AND
   47  PROJECTED REVENUES AND EXPENDITURES FOR THE CURRENT AND FOLLOWING FISCAL
   48  YEARS.
   49    9. PURSUANT TO ARTICLE 5-C OF THE STATE FINANCE LAW, BUT NOTWITHSTAND-
   50  ING  ANY  PROVISIONS  OF  LAW  TO THE CONTRARY, THE NEW YORK STATE URBAN
   51  DEVELOPMENT CORPORATION IS HEREBY AUTHORIZED TO ISSUE BONDS,  NOTES  AND
   52  OTHER  OBLIGATIONS  IN  ONE OR MORE SERIES, AT ANY TIME AND FROM TIME TO
   53  TIME, IN AN AGGREGATE PRINCIPAL AMOUNT NOT TO EXCEED THE  AMOUNT  NECES-
   54  SARY  TO  PROVIDE  NET  PROCEEDS OF NO GREATER THAN FIVE HUNDRED MILLION
   55  DOLLARS FOR THE PURPOSE OF ESTABLISHING THE  FUND  CREATED  PURSUANT  TO
   56  THIS  SECTION. THE AGGREGATE AMOUNT OF BONDS, NOTES OR OTHER OBLIGATIONS
